Prognosis: Full recovery expected within six months
Medical_NLP_Summary.Summary:
Physician: That sounds like a strong impact. Were you wearing your seatbelt?

Patient: Yes, I always do.

Physician: What did you feel immediately after the accident?

Patient: At first, I was just shocked. But then I realized I had hit my head on the steering wheel, and I could feel pain in my neck and back almost right away. Physician: That's encouraging. Let's go ahead and do a physical examination to check your mobility and any lingering pain. Physician: I understand you were in a car accident last September. Can you walk me through what happened?

Patient: Yes, it was on September 1st, around 12:30 in the afternoon. Physician: Did you seek medical attention at that time?

Patient: Yes, I went to Moss Bank Accident and Emergency. Physician: That makes sense. Are you still experiencing pain now?

Patient: It's not constant, but I do get occasional backaches.

Patient_Sentiment_Analysis.Statement: Good morning, doctor. I'm doing better, but I still have some discomfort now and then.

Yes, it was on September 1st, around 12:30 in the afternoon. I was driving from Cheadle Hulme to Manchester when I had to stop in traffic. Out of nowhere, another car hit me from behind, which pushed my car into the one in front.
At first, I was just shocked. But then I realized I had hit my head on the steering wheel, and I could feel pain in my neck and back almost right away.
Yes, I went to Moss Bank Accident and Emergency. They checked me over and said it was a whiplash injury, but they didn't do any X-rays. They just gave me some advice and sent me home.

The first four weeks were rough. My neck and back pain were really bad—I had trouble sleeping and had to take painkillers regularly. It started improving after that, but I had to go through ten sessions of physiotherapy to help with the stiffness and discomfort.
It's not constant, but I do get occasional backaches. It's nothing like before, though.
No, nothing like that. I don't feel nervous driving, and I haven't had any emotional issues from the accident.
I had to take a week off work, but after that, I was back to my usual routine. It hasn't really stopped me from doing anything.
That's great to hear. So, I don't need to worry about this affecting me in the future?
Thank you, doctor. I appreciate it.

Subjective.Chief_Complaint: Back pain, Stiffness, Head impact, Occasional backache, Neck pain, Discomfort, Trouble sleeping
Subjective.History_of_Present_Illness: Good morning, doctor. I'm doing better, but I still have some discomfort now and then. Yes, it was on September 1st, around 12:30 in the afternoon. I was driving from Cheadle Hulme to Manchester when I had to stop in traffic. Out of nowhere, another car hit me from behind, which pushed my car into the one in front.

Objective.Physical_Exam: Everything looks good. Your neck and back have a full range of movement, and there's no tenderness or signs of lasting damage. Your muscles and spine seem to be in good condition.
Objective.Observations: Patient appears matching description of recovery.

Assessment.Diagnosis: Whiplash injury, pain, whiplash injury, tenderness, anxiety, long-term damage, backaches

Plan.Treatment: Ten physiotherapy sessions, Painkillers, No X-rays performed
Plan.Follow-Up: Full recovery expected within six months, No long-term damage expected
